t: Amazon Brand Detector – Get this Extension for 🦊 Firefox (en-US)
s: December 14, 2021 - This extension identifies and highlights Amazon brands and exclusive products in orange as your shop online. Amazon has registered more than 150 brands with the U.S. Trademark and Patent Office and sells hundreds of thousands of items under these names and in exclusive deals with other brands.

t: Reviews for Amazon Brand Detector – Add-ons for Firefox (en-US)
s: ... The extension seems to work as expected. I am able to use this extension on smile.amazon.com with no issues. Amazon Brand Detector is slow at times, but I imagine there are millions of requests to process and links to follow so I only docked it one star for this.

t: This browser extension shows how many brands on Amazon are actually just Amazon | The Verge
s: November 30, 2021 - It’s called Amazon Brand Detector, and it uses a list of Amazon brands created by The Markup, along with filters and other techniques (detailed here) to detect and highlight products that are a part of Amazon’s Our Brands program.
Online shopping from a great selection at Books Store.

t: r/Chinesium on Reddit: Now on Firefox! Seller location and brand origin highlighted via extension - have over 20,000 brands assessed and also showing alternatives made in USA. Other Amazon domains coming soon! Link in comments. Thank you!
s: July 26, 2021 - I can understand how you find the brand, but how are you supposed to get the seller location? Seems kinda shady if its directing you to other products without showing difinitive proof of where it comes from. ... Recently amazon made every seller verify their address. It's all public now. ... Firefox...

t: Amazon Shopping Tools – Get this Extension for 🦊 Firefox (en-US)
s: January 10, 2024 - Once you click on a category, the Best Sellers page will redirect you directly to the Amazon Best Sellers page for your chosen category. There, you'll be able to see the 100 most-ordered products from that selection. ✨What countries are supported by Amazon Shopping Tools?
